document_type: ISO 27001 Security Requirements - Annex A Control
applies_to_note: All gambling operators subject to RTS Chapter 4 - Security Requirements

control.control_purpose: To ensure an agreed level of information security is maintained in supplier relationships and supply chain
control.control_objective: Manage information security risks associated with supplier products and services through defined processes and procedures

iso_27001_definition.official_text: Processes and procedures should be defined and implemented to manage the information security risks associated with the use of supplier's products or services.
key_requirements: Processes defined for supplier information security management
Procedures defined for supplier information security management
Information security risks of suppliers identified and assessed

supplier_relationships_overview.definition: Suppliers are third parties providing products or services that support business operations
supplier_relationships_overview.risk_context: Suppliers represent one of biggest risks as organization cannot directly manage them, likely relies on them, and they may have access to data and critical systems
supplier_relationships_overview.supply_chain_security: Control is about securing the supply chain and managing inherited risks from supplier relationships
supplier_relationships_overview.key_principle: Cannot outsource security responsibility - organization accountable for security of supplier-provided services

implementation_requirements.description: Organization must have documented policy on information security in supplier relationships

details.policy_content: Defines approach to managing supplier information security risks
details.approval: Policy must be approved and communicated to relevant personnel

implementation_requirements.description: Formal process for managing information security throughout supplier relationship lifecycle

process_stages: Classify suppliers by type and risk level
Review controls in place at suppliers
Document what suppliers can access and do
Assess and manage supplier information security risks
Plan for continuity and disaster recovery

implementation_requirements.description: Maintain comprehensive inventory of all suppliers with documented information

details.classification: Categorize suppliers by type (cloud, software, hardware, service providers, etc.)

implementation_requirements.description: Assess suppliers against information security requirements before engagement

details.risk_rating: Assign risk rating based on evaluation findings

implementation_requirements.description: Review what controls suppliers have in place and document appropriateness

controls_review: Encryption of data in transit and at rest
details.documentation: Document what controls are in place and how they address risk
details.adequacy: Determine if controls meet organizational requirements

implementation_requirements.requirement: Document Supplier Data Access and Capabilities
implementation_requirements.description: Clearly document what suppliers can access, monitor, control and use

details.principle: Document actual scope, not generic assumptions
details.purpose: Enable risk assessment and ongoing monitoring of appropriate scope

implementation_requirements.requirement: Assess and Manage Supplier Information Security Risks
implementation_requirements.description: Conduct formal information security risk assessment for suppliers

risk_assessment: Identify potential security threats from supplier
Assess impact if security incident occurs
details.mitigation: Implement controls to reduce identified risks to acceptable level

implementation_requirements.description: Ongoing monitoring to ensure supplier maintains agreed information security standards

monitoring_activities: Receipt of certificates and audit reports
details.frequency: Frequency based on risk level and supplier criticality
details.responsibilities: Define who is responsible for supplier monitoring
details.escalation: Process for escalating concerns to management

implementation_requirements.description: Formal process for managing and mitigating supplier non-compliance
Process for managing security incidents involving suppliers

details.notification: Ensure suppliers have obligation and process to report incidents
details.timeframe: Define acceptable timeframe for incident reporting (e.g., 24-48 hours)
details.support: Provide support for investigation and recovery

implementation_requirements.requirement: Address Availability, Business Continuity and Disaster Recovery
implementation_requirements.description: Ensure supplier provides continuity and recovery to meet organizational needs

details.testing: Require supplier to test and verify recovery procedures
details.documentation: Supplier provides evidence of continuity capabilities

implementation_requirements.description: Define and manage how information is transferred to/from suppliers

transfer_controls: No clear text transmission of sensitive data
details.data_classification: Transfer requirements based on data sensitivity
details.error_handling: Process for managing failed or corrupted transfers

implementation_requirements.description: Formal process for ending supplier relationships and managing transition

details.data_handling: Ensure all data returned, deleted, or transferred securely
details.access_removal: All supplier access to systems, data, facilities removed immediately
details.transition_support: Supplier provides support during transition period
details.verification: Verify all data and access properly handled

implementation_requirements.description: Legal contracts with suppliers defining information security requirements

details.legal_counsel: Seek professional legal counsel for all contracts
details.amendments: Update contracts based on significant changes or risks

implementation_requirements.description: Centralized registry of all suppliers with documented information

details.format: Can be spreadsheet or dedicated system
details.updates: Update when new suppliers added or information changes

implementation_requirements.description: Communicate expectations for physical security at supplier locations

details.verification: Supplier provides evidence of physical security measures

supplier_contract_template_elements.description: Key elements that should be included in supplier agreements

must_include.description: Clearly define what services will be provided, what will be accessed, and limitations
Specify security controls, certifications, and standards supplier must maintain
Include GDPR, data processing obligations, and data subject rights
Require supplier to report security incidents within specified timeframe
Define how access will be granted, managed, and removed
Organization right to audit supplier and verify compliance
Organization right to monitor supplier systems and performance
Indemnification clauses for breaches and failures
Backup, disaster recovery, and contingency planning requirements
Data return, deletion, or transfer upon contract end
Termination process, notice periods, and exit procedures
Process for managing changes to services or infrastructure
Background check and vetting requirements for supplier staff
IP ownership, licensing, and usage rights

compliance_checklist.description: Steps to comply with ISO 27001 Annex A 5.19

common_mistakes.description: Top 3 mistakes organizations make with supplier management

mistakes.mistake: No contracts or legal terms with suppliers
mistakes.description: Operating with suppliers without formal contracts or agreements defining information security obligations
mistakes.impact: No legal recourse if supplier fails to maintain security, no defined obligations
mistakes.prevention: Require contract, agreement, or terms of business for every supplier engagement
mistakes.action: Ensure you have copy of contract, it is current, and covers what you are using from supplier
mistakes.audit_risk: High - immediate finding if no contracts in place

mistakes.mistake: No assurance supplier maintains information security
mistakes.description: No verification or evidence that suppliers are maintaining adequate information security controls
root_cause: Failure to request and verify certifications
mistakes.evidence_needed: In-date certificate such as ISO 27001 Certification
mistakes.coverage: Certificate must cover products/services actually being used from supplier
mistakes.action: Obtain and verify security assessment or certification for each supplier
mistakes.verification: Ensure certification is current and applicable to services being provided
mistakes.audit_risk: High - auditor will ask for proof supplier maintains security

mistakes.mistake: Document and version control is wrong
mistakes.description: Poor documentation and version control of supplier management procedures and records
issues: Version numbers don't match across references
mistakes.impact: Shows lack of control and organization of supply chain

audit_requirements.description: What auditors will check during ISO 27001 A 5.19 audit

audit_areas.description: Auditor checks supplier management process is documented and followed
audit_areas.best_practice: Maintain evidence of all supplier management activities

audit_areas.description: Verify Supplier Register exists, is current, and accurate
audit_areas.easiest_win: Request Supplier Register - if doesn't exist or is significantly out of date, immediate finding

audit_areas.description: Verify contracts exist and contain information security terms
Verify suppliers maintain adequate information security
checks: ISO 27001 or relevant certification held by suppliers
Regular reviews of supplier security posture

audit_areas.description: Verify ongoing monitoring and management of supplier compliance

checks: Documents current and reviewed in 12 months

ukgc_application.critical_systems_context: Supplier management critical for protecting all critical gambling systems - suppliers may provide infrastructure, software, or services essential to system operation

supplier_requirements: Payment processor must be PCI DSS compliant and regularly audited
Data processor must be GDPR compliant with Data Processing Agreement
Cloud provider storing customer data must have ISO 27001 certification
Hosting provider must have redundancy and disaster recovery
Regular audit of supplier controls for customer data
Supplier incident reporting for any customer data breaches
Strict data return and deletion upon termination
RNG supplier must have audited and certified RNG
RNG software supplier must have extensive testing documentation
Hosting provider for RNG systems must have highest security standards
RNG supplier must provide audit reports and certifications
Regular independent verification of RNG supplier controls
Access controls to RNG systems managed per contract
Incident reporting for any RNG-related issues
Database provider must have backup and disaster recovery
Storage provider must ensure data integrity and non-repudiation
Provider must maintain audit logs of all database access
Provider must have incident response capability
Regular assessment of storage provider controls

specific_requirements.system: System Access Points and Entry/Exit Controls
supplier_requirements: Firewall/network security supplier must provide configuration control
VPN/remote access provider must enforce multi-factor authentication
Access control system supplier must provide audit trails
Regular review of supplier controls
Network provider must provide encryption capabilities
Internet service provider must have DDoS protection
CDN provider must have security controls
Supplier must respond to security incidents
Regular performance and security monitoring

ukgc_application.compliance_requirement: Operators must implement comprehensive supplier management including formal assessments, contracts with security terms, ongoing monitoring, and documented risk management for all critical suppliers

compliance_notes.overall_purpose: Manage information security risks in supply chain through defined processes, formal agreements, and ongoing monitoring of suppliers
compliance_notes.enforcement_priority: High - supply chain security is critical dependency for overall security
key_principles: All suppliers must be identified and assessed
Formal contracts with information security terms required
Business continuity and disaster recovery planning
Clear data handling and return procedures
Segregation of duties in supplier approval
Regular review of supplier performance and security

to_pass_the_audit.description: To comply with ISO 27001 Annex A 5.19 Information Security in Supplier Relationships, implement the following

requirements.detail: Documented policy on managing supplier information security risks
Formal procedures covering full supplier relationship lifecycle
Centralized registry with all suppliers and relevant information
Comprehensive inventory of all suppliers with documented data access
Security assessment of all suppliers against organizational requirements
Legal contracts with information security terms and requirements
Formal information security risk assessment for each supplier
Process for identifying and remediating supplier non-compliance
Process for managing supplier-related security incidents
Supplier commitments for business continuity and disaster recovery
Process for ending relationships and transitioning services
Educate staff on supplier management procedures
